page.title: 10CULWORTH POLICEMAN
page.content: ROBERT CANAWAY AGED IO REPORTS ON A SHARED DAY WITH HIS FATHER PC CANAWAY. After leaving the Police House on the ouskirts of the village,the first visit of the day was to check on the local Post Office before driving to Chipping Warden School.The purpose of the visit to the school was to repeat and stress advice about Road Safety following a local accident involving a child. After a visit to Towcester to check the police car we proceeded to Daventry Police Station.My dad took me round the cells.Each cell had a wooden flimsy looking bench.There was only one window to let light in.The doors were steel and about 8cm thick,(I've decided I'm going to be good for the rest of my life.) We had a snack in the canteen, and patrolled local villages.I met the superintendant in charge of the station.
